overview: Marc most recently served as Vice President of Business Development for Match.com, an operating business of InterActive Corp. Marc learned first-hand the reach and communications potential of the Internet when he served as Vice President for the pioneering Broadcast.com, working directly with the start-upâ€™s visionary leaders, Mark Cuban and Todd Wagner. He previously served as senior director of Yahoo Broadcast until 2002, where he conceived, launched and managed the Yahoo Broadcast video platform. Marc left Yahoo in 2002 to join AOL, where he held a variety of leadership positions, including executive director for broadband content acquisition and later for broadband advertising and development. Prior to joining Broadcast.com, Marc was Director of Internet Sales at WFAA-TV (Dallas), one of the top ABC affiliates in the country. He is a graduate of The University of Texas at Austin.
